title: From gun violence to great composers: Meet our Student Podcast Challenge finalists
description: In its fifth year, our contest received more than 3,300 entries from around the country – and we've narrowed it down to 13 middle school and 13 high school finalists.

title: 40 years ago, Sally Ride became the first American woman in space
description: On June 18, 1983, she made history aboard the space shuttle. America's first woman in space had joined NASA after responding to a newspaper ad. "I knew that's what I wanted to do," she said.

title: You don't need a grill to grill, advises award-winning cookbook author
description: James Whetlor, author of The DIY BBQ Cookbook, explains how to reject BBQ maximalism and build your own tandoori oven out of flowerpots, and grill on the holes of cinderblocks.

title: History-making whistleblower Daniel Ellsberg has died at 92
description: Ellsberg's release of what were called the "Pentagon Papers" hastened the end of the Vietnam war, prompted a landmark Supreme Court ruling and contributed to the downfall of President Richard Nixon.

title: Are masks for the birds? We field reader queries about this new stage of the pandemic
description: The official emergency is over but COVID is still here. And that means ... lots of questions. We asked our readers what's on their mind and then called on experts for advice.

title: Gas stoves pollute homes with benzene, which is linked to cancer
description: Benzene is among the pollutants gas stoves emit into homes, Stanford University researchers show. The toxin is linked to a higher risk of leukemia and other blood cell cancers.

title: He interviewed his daughter on her birthday for 17 years. This is what he learnt
description: What does a modern childhood and father-daughter relationship look like? One man documented the journey.

title: DOJ report finds systemic patterns of abuse by the Minneapolis Police Department
description: The Justice Department, city and police will begin negotiations to set the terms of a consent decree, which will bring federal oversight to police

title: Cyclist Gino Mäder, 26, dies after a high-speed crash in the Swiss Alps
description: After Gino Mäder and another rider crashed, criticisms emerged about the race layout, which put the finish line down a steep descent. The police also say they're investigating the incident.

title: Blinken travels to China amid low expectations and global worries of a new cold war
description: In a first visit to China by a member of President Biden's Cabinet, the secretary of state will seek "open lines of communication" with Beijing but no diplomatic breakthrough is expected.

title: Biden taps Mandy Cohen — former North Carolina health secretary — to lead CDC
description: President Biden's pick for the next director of the CDC is Dr. Mandy Cohen, an internal medicine physician with experience in state and federal government.

title: An associate of Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny is sentenced to prison for extremism
description: Lilia Chanysheva was sentenced to 7 1/2 years in prison in the latest in a series of lengthy prison terms handed down to Kremlin political opponents. Women are increasingly singled out for repression.

title: After indictment, majority want Trump to drop out, but he's getting stronger with GOP
description: After a federal indictment and arraignment, Donald Trump sees support among Republicans grow as independents move away from the former president and 2024 candidate.

title: Testosterone is probably safe for your heart. But it can't stop 'manopause'
description: A new study finds men with low T who used a gel to increase the hormone did not have a higher rate of heart attacks than men on a placebo. But the anti-aging benefits are iffy.

title: 'Still alive,' Pope Francis jokes as he leaves a Rome hospital 9 days after surgery
description: "The pope is well. He's better than before,'' said Dr. Sergio Alfieri, the surgeon who performed the 86-year-old pontiff's operation on June 7.

title: When Pakistan's politics get tough, Pakistanis respond with memes and humor
description: Political humor in Pakistan has evolved over the years to evade censorship and other restrictions. After ex-Prime Minister Imran Khan's arrest in May, the internet exploded with memes and jokes.

title: Some see the U.S.-China rivalry as an 'existential struggle.' Rep. Andy Kim disagrees
description: Kim, who sits on the House China panel, disagrees with its chair's characterization of the rivalry. He hopes that Secretary of State Antony Blinken's visit will mean more regular talks with China.

title: The U.S. must set up regular engagement with China, Rep. Andy Kim says
description: Ahead of Secretary of State Blinken's trip to China, NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Democratic Rep. Andy Kim of New Jersey, a member of the House China committee, about Washington's approach to Beijing.

title: Opioid settlement payouts are now public — and we know how much local governments got
description: KFF Health News obtained documents showing the exact dollar amounts — down to the cent — that local governments have been paid in 2022 and 2023 in lawsuit settlements from the opioid crisis.

title: As the U.S. and democracies worldwide face threats, Britain shows how to fight back
description: With democracy under siege around the world, the U.K. offers a glimmer of hope. Despite attacks from former Prime Minister Boris Johnson, Britain's institutions resisted.

title: Biden's campaign is getting rolling. Here's what's been happening behind the scenes
description: President Biden launched his reelection campaign almost two months ago. But behind the scenes, there's been a lot of work laying the ground for fundraising and organizing at the DNC.

title: Yes, the big news is Trump. Test your knowledge of everything else in NPR's news quiz
description: Who won the week? The Tonys? Jack Smith? UPS delivery persons? Generative AI? Joe Biden's dentist? Or YOU ... if you've been paying attention.

title: A father needed to get to his daughter in the ICU. A stranger helped him get there
description: When Daniel Willingham's daughter ended up in the ICU, an unsung hero stepped up to help him get there.

title: Pfizer warns of a looming penicillin supply shortage
description: The shortage comes as there has been a steady increase in rates of syphilis since 2000. Inventory can start depleting as early as this month, Pfizer said.

title: An American is arrested over the death of a U.S. tourist at a German castle
description: An American man has been arrested over the death of one U.S. tourist and an assault on another near Neuschwanstein castle after he allegedly pushed the two women down a steep slope, authorities said.

title: 15 die after a bus full of seniors heading to a casino in Canada collides with truck
description: A spokesperson for the Royal Canadian Mounted Police said the bus was carrying 25 people and authorities in Manitoba were deploying all their resources to the scene.
